i1.name: Adaptive Defenses
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Periodically, '''Camille's''' next [[basic attack]] against enemy champions is enhanced to {{tip|shield}} her for {{sti|{{as|20% of her '''maximum''' health}}}} for 2 seconds from either exclusively {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} or {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}}, based on which type the target has previously dealt most of against champions as well as on '''Camille's''' '''current''' {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|{{as|magic resistance}}}}.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Periodically, Camille's next basic attack against enemy champions is enhanced to shield her for 20% of her maximum health for 2 seconds from either exclusively physical damage or magic damage, based on which type the target has previously dealt most of against champions as well as on Camille's current armor and magic resistance.
i1.notes:
* ''Adaptive Defenses'' goes on cooldown after the shield expires or is destroyed.
* The shield-typing is determined based on the '''total''' damage the target has dealt to champions that game (as a percentage) versus '''Camille's''' '''current''' {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|{{as|magic resistance}}}}.
** For example, with little '''bonus''' resistances '''Camille''' would likely gain the most obvious shield-typing - i.e. [[Shield#Physical shields|physical shield]] versus champions primarily dealing {{as|physical damage}} and [[Shield#Magic shields|magic shield]] versus champions primarily dealing {{as|magic damage}}. However, if she has a sufficient amount of {{as|armor}} against a champion dealing both alternates of {{as|physical damage}} and {{as|magic damage}}, she will receive a magic shield as the {{as|physical damage}} threat is already being mitigated by her {{as|armor}}, and vice versa.
* The type of shield that will be granted to '''Camille''' when she attacks any one enemy champion is shown as an icon beneath their [[health bar]]: {{as|orange|physical damage}} for physical shield and {{as|blue|magic damage}} for magic shield.
* ''Adaptive Defenses'' takes priority over all other {{tip|shield|shields}} except {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana}}.

w1.name: Tactical Sweep
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' sweeps her leg to deal {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in a cone in the target direction after a {{fd|1.1}}-second delay, during which she's {{tip|ghosted}} and is unable to declare basic attacks.

Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 80% that decays over 2 seconds, capped at 300 damage against {{tip|monsters}}. '''Camille''' is {{tip|healing|healed}} for 100% of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} dealt against enemy {{tip|champions}} in the outer half.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from ''Tactical Sweep''.
''Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille sweeps her leg to deal physical damage to all enemies in a cone in the target direction after a 1.1-second delay, during which she's ghosted and is unable to declare basic attacks.
Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take bonus physical damage and are slowed by 80% that decays over 2 seconds, capped at 300 damage against monsters. Camille is healed for 100% of the post-mitigation damage dealt against enemy champions in the outer half.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from Tactical Sweep.
Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|70 to 190}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{ap|70/2 to 190/2}} {{as|(+ 30% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}

{{st|Outer Cone Bonus Damage|{{as|{{ap|6 to 8}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|3.{{recurring|3}}}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Bonus Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{as|{{ap|6/2 to 8/2}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|1.{{recurring|6}}}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}}}
w1.notes:
* '''Camille''' can move during the delay, but the hitbox and '''Camille's''' visuals are fixed to the initial target direction.
** '''Camille's''' facing-direction, for effects such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}, is the direction she is moving, and not the direction the model is facing.
* The 50% damage reduction against non-epic monsters applies after the cap. Because of this the actual cap against non-epic monsters is 150 damage.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 60% bonus AD)
  • Non-Epic Monster Damage: (+ 30% bonus AD)

• Outer Cone Bonus Damage: % (+ 3.Unknown value: recurring 3% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health
  • Bonus Non-Epic Monster Damage: % (+ 1.Unknown value: recurring 6% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health

st_slices: % (+ 3.Unknown value: recurring 3% per 100 '''bonus''' AD) of target's '''maximum''' health
% (+ 1.Unknown value: recurring 6% per 100 '''bonus''' AD) of target's '''maximum''' health

r1.name: The Hextech Ultimatum
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' becomes {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|dash|leaps}} with {{tip|displacement immunity}} towards the target enemy {{tip|champion|champion}} over {{fd|0.6}} seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} them for the duration and {{tip|disrupt|disrupting}} their ongoing {{tip|channel|channels}}.
When '''Camille''' lands, she becomes targetable again and creates a hexagonal zone around her current location for a duration, {{tip|airborne|knocking away}} all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, '''Camille's''' basic attacks deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}.
''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends automatically within 1 second if '''Camille''' leaves the area or dies.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Camille becomes untargetable and leaps with displacement immunity towards the target enemy champion over 0.6 seconds, revealing them for the duration and disrupting their ongoing channels.
When Camille lands, she becomes targetable again and creates a hexagonal zone around her current location for a duration, knocking away all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, Camille's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.
The Hextech Ultimatum ends automatically within 1 second if Camille leaves the area or dies.
r1.notes:
* The {{tip|disrupt}} is 'wrapped' into a status effect that says the target is {{tip|Silence|Silenced}} for {{fd|0.4}} seconds, but it does not actually ''silence''. It however makes sure that the ''disrupt'' is prevented by {{tip|Cc-immune|immunity to silences}}.
* '''Camille''' will attempt to basic attack the target upon landing.
* The ability will cancel and go on {{sti|cooldown}} and expend {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} if the target {{tip|death|dies}} or becomes {{tip|untargetable}} during the dash.
* '''Camille''' will follow targets that change locations (e.g. {{tip|airborne|displacements}}, {{tip|blink|blinks}}, {{tip|dash|dashes}}) but not those that exceed the range limit, in which case ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' is cancelled and goes on {{sti|cooldown}} and expends {{sti|{{as|mana}}}}.
* {{tip|Airborne|Knockaway}} speed is 1000.
* If the target manages to be outside of the boundaries, they will immediately be pulled back towards the center of the hexagon.
* The boundaries are not considered terrain ({{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} exception), and enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
** {{tip|Dash|Dashes}}, {{tip|blink|blinks}}, {{tip|airborne|displacements}}, and other forms of movement will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
** {{cai|Chronobreak|Ekko}} will still deal damage at the hologram's location.
** An active {{ai|Assault and Battery|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
** If the target {{tip|attached|attaches}} to a unit, they will only be displaced back inside once they detach. ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' does not end nor break the bind to the victim. 
*** {{cai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}} allows him to cast it even if his target is outside the area, dashing through the borders and attaching despite being unable to escape.
*** {{cai|You and Me!|Yuumi}} allows her to bypass the borders if the unit she attaches to leaves the area.
*** {{cai|The Show Stopper|Sett}} does not allow him to pass through the borders and the dash will end prematurely when he encounters them.
**** If the target of {{ai|The Show Stopper|Sett}} is also the target of ''The Hextech Ultimatum'', they can go through the borders while attached to him.
* If '''Camille''' enters {{tip|resurrection}} during the initial cast, the {{tip|dash}} is stopped and the zone is formed immediately.
** ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends if the target enters ''resurrection'', but not if '''Camille''' does.
* ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends immediately if the target is dragged by {{ai|Fear Beyond Death 2|Urgot|Fear Beyond Death}} or eaten by {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Camille''' is dashing.
{{ct|attack=false|cast=false|move=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=false|interrupts=death}}

effects.str: • Bonus Magic Damage: (+ % of target's current health)
